comment:
* A BidiRun represents a sequence of characters at the same embedding level. * The Bidi algorithm decomposes a piece of text into sequences of characters * at the same embedding level, each such sequence is called a "run". * *

A BidiRun represents such a run by storing its essential properties, * but does not duplicate the characters which form the run. * *

The "limit" of the run is the position just after the * last character, i.e., one more than that position. * *

This class has no public constructor, and its members cannot be * modified by users. * * @see android.icu.text.Bidi

variables.name: limit
variables.comment: first logical position of the run

variables.name: insertRemove
variables.comment: last visual position of the run +1

variables.name: level
variables.comment:
if >0, flags for inserting LRM/RLM before/after run,
                               if <0, count of bidi controls within run

methods.name: void copyFrom(BidiRun run)
methods.comment: * Copy the content of a BidiRun instance

methods.name: public int getStart()
methods.comment: * Get the first logical position of the run in the source text

methods.name: public int getLimit()
methods.comment: * Get position of one character after the end of the run in the source text

methods.name: public boolean isOddRun()
methods.comment:
* Check if run level is odd
     * @return true if the embedding level of this run is odd, i.e. it is a
     *  right-to-left run.

methods.name: public boolean isEvenRun()
methods.comment:
* Check if run level is even
     * @return true if the embedding level of this run is even, i.e. it is a
     *  left-to-right run.
